_json.gridTitle: Grammatical Conversation or English Grammer Familiarised | Unknown | V&A Explore The Collections
_json.description: c.1790 Grammatical Conversation or English Grammer Familiarised. English grammar was inculcated by this game. Cards are divided into 2 sets, 1 of questions & 1 with answers. The answer cards are dealt while one person, probably an older child or adult, holds the questions and key card. As each question is answered correctly, the players relinquish their cards. Whoever gets rid of their cards first wins. Could include a gambling by having a pool & rewards & forfeits. V E.5306& 1 to 61-1960
